meanings.definition: To publish or broadcast (a story or play) in regular installments.
meanings.sent1: The author decided to serialized her novel, releasing a new chapter every week.
meanings.sent2: The TV network serialized the popular show, airing one episode each day.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would serialized his jokes, telling one punchline per day.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a serialized drama, with each day bringing a new twist.
meanings.sent5: The teacher serialized the history lessons, covering a different era each week.

meanings.definition: To divide (data) into a series of parts for transmission or storage.
meanings.sent1: The computer program serialized the information for easy transfer.
meanings.sent2: The company serialized the files to ensure they could be easily accessed.
meanings.sent3: The student joked that he would serialized his homework to make it more manageable.
meanings.sent4: The data scientist compared the process to how a book is serialized into chapters.
meanings.sent5: The scientist serialized the research findings, organizing them into distinct sections.

meanings.sent1: She serialized the books on the shelf by genre for easy browsing.
meanings.sent2: The collector serialized the stamps in his album according to their year of issue.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to serialized the dishes on the menu by their main ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The artist serialized the paintings in the gallery based on their color palette.
meanings.sent5: The librarian serialized the books on the display shelf by their publication date.
